40655820.review:
[h1]Propulsé sur Steam durant le mois de février, Remnants of Naezith nous offre un jeu de plateforme assez intéressant, bien que constamment frustrant par la dureté de ses niveaux. C'est le style de jeu qui favorise grandement le réflexe, la rapidité d'action et la jugeote, mais ne va t-il pas un peu loin ?[/h1]

 [url=https://cadeauxsteam.com/articles/read/97/on-a-pose-le-grappin-sur-remnants-of-naezith]Cette critique est plus simple à lire depuis notre site internet, mais vous pouvez également la lire ici.[/url]

Il est assez difficile de doser la dureté et la difficulté d'un jeu de plateforme : soit il se termine sans le moindre effort et l'on est déçu, soit on s'arrache les cheveux dessus, et c'est pas forcément meilleur. Remnants of Naezith semble appartenir à cette deuxième catégorie : celle des jeux particulièrement difficile. Il faut s'orienter dans une map basique 2D en se gérant entre l'utilisation du grappin, du " dash ", pouvoir de courir en Sonic, réglé sous le système d'endurance de la stamina. En jouant au jeu, et c'est peut-être le plus grand problème, c'est qu'il faut à la fois viser la destination au grappin, se préparer à ( éventuellement ) utiliser un dash pour passer au-dessus de l'eau et bien évidemment sauter, tout en évitant les pics, qui sont absolument partout ...

 

Et c'est peut-être le problème d'un jeu difficile : trop envahi par la volonté de faire un jeu difficile, on oublie totalement le level design, plus de paysage ou de beauté, on place juste de la terre entre des pièges : c'est dommage ! C'est la particularité toujours un peu décevante, bien que naturelle des jeux de plateforme. Quand on y pense, les jeux de plateforme les plus célèbres sont ceux qui combinent la beauté du level design, ainsi que la beauté.

Une grande volonté nous pousse également à nous surpasser en utilisant le terrible système compétitif du classement mondial. Même si l'on ne cherche pas réellement à le savoir, ça peut être des fois très élogieux, comme un peu génant dans le cas ou l'on est fière de nous mais que l'on termine presque dans les derniers : à noter que le classement mondial compte en moyenne 2000 à 1500 scores ( un score représente le meilleur fait par le joueur ).

Le fait de nous coller automatiquement avec un fantôme : c'est intéressant, mais frustrant à la longue. Il est beaucoup trop rapide pour nous, il est censé nous guider mais en réalité, on le croise juste à la ligne de départ et l'on sait que par la suite, on le verra plus. Dans l'idéal, il faudrait que le fantôme au même chekcpoint. D'ailleurs les checkpoint, ça part d'une bonne intention, mais est-ce vraiment compatible avec la particularité de nous faire effectuer de bons score en temps ? Il faudrait nous proposer la particularité de recommencer tout le niveau, sans avoir à retourner au menu de choix des niveaux.

En bilan, un jeu globalement intéressant, cependant, il y'a du travail à apporter afin de le rendre plus intéressant. On en est fou, mais c'est sympa pour le défis que le jeu apporte. Ne vous attendez pas à du beau paysage cependant.

40194798.review:
本评测游戏由奶牛关野蔷薇计划及开发者提供，图文完整版可访问奶牛关CowLevel浏览：
[url=cowlevel.net/game/Remnants_of_Naezith/review/2995880] Remnants of Naezith [/url]

[b] RoN作为一款硬核平台动作游戏，在应有的高难度关卡的基础上搭配动感的电音背景音乐，丰富多样的关卡设计和顺滑的操作手感大大提升了游戏的可玩性，是一款足以让玩家“痛并快乐着”的游戏。 [/b]

[h1] 画面&音乐 [/h1]

RoN作为一款平台动作游戏，场景相对比较开阔。一般一关之中人物会跨越多屏穿越障碍物并最终到达终点，因此障碍物等元素显得相对较小，细节方面能达到让玩家区分出哪些是会致自己于死地的陷阱，仅此而已。相比之下，游戏中光线的细节表现的更为到位：主角手中不停旋转的雷电勾爪、缠绕在勾爪绳索上的雷电光线、人物经过之处飘散在空中的“光尘”、使用冲刺技能时包围全身的光团都很炫酷。事实上，在游戏中每一关的障碍中穿梭时根本无暇太多顾及游戏的画面表现，不断跳动的时间计数和其他玩家过关回放残影时刻刺激着玩家的神经，可能给玩家留下印象最深刻的就是每一关中那些卡关的致命障碍了。

游戏过程中的音乐是一个亮点，这在游戏的宣传片中也有所体现。背景音乐选择了节奏感比较强的电音风格，总共包含大概四到五段不同的音乐循环播放，在游戏中画面的右上角会显示当前播放的音乐名称。每一关中到达终点找到巨龙的一部分遗骸只是完成这一关的最基本条件，以最短的时间到达终点才是每一关追求的终极目标，因此快节奏的电音一方面能与快速的游戏节奏搭配上，另一方面也增加了玩家的紧张感，不断刺激着玩家的重开游戏千百遍之后的脆弱神经。如此高质量的背景音乐作为游戏的免费DLC可供玩家下载后随时欣赏，想必在各种以音乐为驱动元素的游戏中使用RoN的背景音乐体验也是极好的。

[h1] 游戏玩法 [/h1]

大部分硬核平台动作游戏中，主角的基本能力都是以冲刺跑、二段跳为主的，而RoN中主角使用的装备是缠绕在双手上的两个勾爪，这让人不禁联想起了有名的多人撕逼竞速游戏SpeedRunners。玩家释放勾爪抓住墙壁，通过摆荡后松开勾爪来提升自己的速度，就像我们在现实中荡秋千一样。松开勾爪的时机决定了人物的飞行方向，也就是朝着摆荡圆周运动的切线方向，这一点是完全遵循最基本的物理规律的，而游戏中各种复杂的地形决定了玩家需要精准控制好释放勾爪的时机，使得人物能够避开致命的尖刺或旋转的电锯。

冲刺是游戏中人物的另一个技能，使用冲刺技能时会消耗一定的能量，一条完整的能量槽可供玩家连续使用三次冲刺技能，而能量槽中的能量会缓慢回复。冲刺技能可以在多种情况下使用，比如松开勾爪的一瞬间使用冲刺可以给玩家在行进方向上有一个加速度，瞬间提升飞行速度；而在摆荡过程中使用冲刺可以增加摆荡的速度，从而实现绕着一点做圆周运动的效果。与选择释放勾爪时机类似，使用冲刺技能的时机同样是需要反复练习的技巧，如果使用的时间点不对，不但达不到加速的效果，反而会影响玩家后续的行进路线选择，甚至直接撞到尖刺上。

二段跳作为广大动作游戏中最基本的技能之一，RoN中的主角自然也可以使用，只不过在游戏中相对于勾爪和冲刺来讲存在感低一些。游戏过程中绝大部分躲避障碍和机关的操作都需要靠摆荡和冲刺两个动作完成，二段跳更多的是作为调整人物位置和两次发射勾爪之间的衔接动作来用的，因此在游戏中更多是作为一种辅助动作来使用。

RoN没有教学关的设计，在游戏菜单部分也找不到类似于“How to play”的操作讲解，第一次进行游戏的玩家可能会对操作感到困惑。其实游戏的第一个大场景“Jade”中的某些关卡开头是有这一关会用到的操作技巧提示的，开发者显然是希望玩家可以在实际游戏的过程中可以通过反复尝试或者观看其他玩家的过关回放动画来逐渐熟悉操作。实际在游戏过程中可以感受到，这种操作教学形式还是比较平滑而且易于接受的。使用一个教学关或者操作说明页一股脑地把游戏的所有操作技巧一次性展示给玩家的话，真正在每一关游戏过程中并不一定能回忆起来遇到什么样的地形应该使用怎样的技巧。而将教学融入到关卡中既能使操作难度平滑过渡，也加深了玩家对在处理特定地形时所使用技巧的印象，反而能更快上手。

总体来讲RoN对于玩家的操作熟练度与精准度要求很高，如果在顺利到达每一关终点的基础上还想要追求快速过关，反复死亡不断重试是玩家唯一可以选择的一条路。我在完成这篇评测文章前花费了6个小时将游戏第一章节的全部20关过关时间成绩刷到了排行榜的前三名，而且大部分关卡都达到了Master的级别。如果游戏有一个死亡次数计数的话，恐怕我的人物已经反复死亡重试了好几百次了，由此这个游戏的硬核程度可见一斑。

[h1] 游戏性 [/h1]

[i] 操作机制 [/i]

与一般硬核平台动作游戏中最常见的二段跳技能不同，本作中人物主要使用的是勾爪摆荡的技能。下面我们看看这两种技能可以影响的因素：

[list]
    [*]二段跳：高度、方向(八方向)
    [*]勾爪摆荡：高度、方向(全方向)、速度
[/list]

高度因素比较好理解，二段跳通过第二次跳跃改变人物能够达到的高度，勾爪利用摆荡也可以使人物达到更高的高度。但利用二段跳能达到的高度极限最多就是两次跳跃的最大距离加和，而勾爪摆荡是根据松开勾爪前的线速度决定人物能够达到的最大高度的，因此勾爪能够更大程度上影响高度因素。

一般二段跳可以跳跃的方向是固定的八方向，而勾爪改变人物的运动方向是由释放勾爪瞬间圆周运动的切线方向决定的，相比之下勾爪可以更自由地改变人物的运动方向。

勾爪摆荡改变人物运动速度是根据物理规律实现的，人物圆周运动到最低点时释放勾爪可以提供最大的水平速度，利用这个原理通过多次摆荡释放勾爪可以迅速提升人物的运动速度，而这是二段跳无法改变的因素。

正因为勾爪摆荡的操作方式可以更自由地影响上面这三个因素，这使游戏在地图设计、障碍物分布方便的自由度大大提高，以往通过二段跳等基本操作无法跨越的障碍都可以在游戏中出现。地图和障碍设计的限制少了，关卡的多样性自然就会相应提升。在游戏第一部分的20关中，我见识到了全程必须依靠勾爪摆荡前进的悬空关卡、有长距离水面需要提前利用摆荡加速积攒动能的关卡、整张地图只有三个悬空障碍需要依靠圆周加速到达终点的关卡等等，虽然每一关的难度不低，但多样的关卡设计增加了新鲜感，同时也丰富了玩家的操作体验。

[i] 捷径 [/i]

捷径是这个游戏的另一个特色，这体现在很多关卡中。看似到达终点的路径一目了然的关卡，浏览用时最短的玩家的游戏回放时会发现居然还有更简洁的方法可以到达终点，而这些方法往往需要更高的操作技巧。

对于操作技巧不够高的玩家来讲，依照最明显的过关路径步步为营即可到达终点；而那些想要挑战极限过关时间和复杂操作技巧的玩家又可以选择难度更高的路线到达终点。捷径设计的优点就在于此，它同时给不同操作水平玩家带来了游戏乐趣。

[i] 竞速 [/i]

不仅仅是到达每一关的终点，不断挑战自己的极限以最短时间过关同样可以给玩家带来快感。RoN中“Ghost”机制的设计就是为竞速准备的。即使不是在线与其他玩家一起比赛，别人的过关回放会以“Ghost”的形式出现在玩家自己游戏的过程中，既给自己增加了快速过关的压力，又能以此了解其他玩家过关路线的选择。流畅而且没有失误就到达终点，而且还比其他玩家的“Ghost”更快到达，到达终点一瞬间的长舒一口气的爽快只有亲自体验一把才能懂。

[h1] 总结 [/h1]

[i] 优点 [/i]

+ 顺滑的操作手感

+ 丰富多样的关卡设计

+ 节奏感强烈的电音

+ 独特的Ghost游戏机制

[i] 缺点 [/i]

- 部分难度较高的关卡对手残党不够友好

- 部分关卡的Master级别标准过高

40141009.review:
It might be fun to others, but to me it's mostly frustrating. 

I only want one thing from games like these, smooth flowing movement. But this game seems to mess up the only thing I want from it. Here, a list of all things that make movement bogged down:
- There seems to be some extreme air resistance above a certain speed.
- The jump is very low.
- The double jump seems to just move you up a bit and then extreme vertical friction kicks in.
- The same as above goes for the boost only horizontal.
- The grapling hook throwing is on a static angle, while this probably improves challange, it reduces freedom.
- Thouching the floor slows you down drasticly.
- And the moving towards the hook is just the worst, it cancels nearly all your swing speed causing you to just go straight for the hook no matter that you were swing at high speed, screwing over your built up speed in the process.
- To add insult to injury the movement towards the hook doesn't even stop when you let go of the corresponding button.

Other than the issues with the movement the controls are quite uncanny. I just couldn't get the hang of the buttons somehow, not to mention that the pull to hook button is the same as the jump button.

While playing this it felt more like I was playing against the game than with the game. It was mostly just frustrating. Perhaps it's more fun when you get good at it. But I have better things to do than mastering a game I do not enjoy.

TL;DR
movement feels bogged down, controls are akward.
40141009.developer_response:
Hello, thanks for trying the game! I totally understand you, game has unusual controls and physics, so it requires time before you start enjoying it fully. I hear this a lot, it's pretty normal.

To be informative, I'd like to clarify some tech behind physics. Also the design choices we took together with the beta community with speedrunners. You can enable Speedometer in Gameplay Settings to verify these if you'd like.

- There is no air resistance/drag. Nothing changes your speed if you are just flying in the air even at crazily high speeds. You keep your momentum.
- Jump is low because it's a support mechanic, hook being the main one. However there is "Dash-Jump" which makes you jump a lot higher.
- There is no air friction again, the thing which stops you vertically is the "Variable Height" tech which makes your jumps higher as you hold it longer, so you can control the height.
- Dash boost speed is given for 0.5 seconds and then it's taken back, otherwise it makes you too fast too easily, becomes very unbalanced. So it's like temporary boost. But it works only horizontally so you can convert that horizontal speed to vertical speed by swinging with the hook and keep your momentum.
- We tried every single hook angle and control schemes, this one provided the easiest and fastest gameplay because you need to think less when you get used to this angle. But I agree it's very unusual for beginners.
- Touching to floor does not affect your horizontal speed in any way. Only water does this. 
- Pull works against the physics unfortunately yes, but it was the most balanced and controllable one. We tried lots of different things like pulling with your current speed or having gravity on while pulling. These didn't work satisfying enough. 
- Pull mechanic works with Hook + Jump buttons combined. I'd love to hear if there is a good alternative while keeping the button count low, that would be very helpful. If you release hook, it stops pulling. But it doesn't stop if you release hook, because hook is the "hold" button, jump button is for activation of the pull only. We also tried releasing jump button makes you keep swinging without releasing the hook. But it was very unnatural because there are is no cooldown and you can keep release and press jump button to activate pull on and off and swing a bit between those, looks incredibly weird.

Thanks again for the feedback, have a nice day!

40090435.review:
Ok. So after seeing this game posted incessantly all over r/speedrun, and on the recommendation of a couple of friends, I figured I'd try it out.

This game isn't fun to me. The controls are wonky, Kayra likes to eat shit into walls/spikes/death pits if you lose momentum, and why is there a ghost from the very beginning? I don't want to know how well other people are doing compared to me on my first time playing the game, I want to play and enjoy the game. I figured out you can turn off ghost replays in the menu, but seriously, why are they there the first time I ever play the level? I didn't feel like I was playing and learning, I was literally just copying what I saw the ghost do, which is boring. A couple of levels I literally just waited for the ghost to show me what to do before trying it.

I understand that this is an indie game, but I literally just feel like I'm playing a Terraria mod or something with how...boring the graphics are. 90% of the levels I played were corridors leading me to the end. Also, a small nitpick - the graphics at the bottom right (your percentage and position) overlap when showing your rank at the level leaderboard.

I've played a lot of Super Meat Boy and a bit of Dustforce. This game felt like neither of those. I enjoyed my time with those games. I tried to like this game, but ultimately just wanted to stop playing after a while because it was boring and frustrating. There didn't feel like many (or any) backup strats were available for levels if you failed because of the prevalence of insta-death pits, the lack of stuff to grapple and the general crappiness of how Kayra does while attached to walls.
40090435.developer_response:
Hello there, thanks for trying the game out!

Spent years on controls and mechanics so it would be a nice feedback if you can expand the controls being wonky.

Game has the ghost system as you noticed. It makes you race with the player one rank better than you. If it's your first play, you don't have a rank yet. At that point we thought a "Mastery" ghost would be nice as it does not depend on the rank. It's not a leaderboard ghost. It belongs to the level. So having that Mastery Ghost gives us couple benefits, 

- It introduces the Ghost System even for the people who plays every level once, otherwise they wouldn't see the Ghost System. And as you saw there is an option to disable it.
- Even if it's not the purpose of the Mastery Ghost, it can guide the player a little bit if player is fast enough. 
- It shows how fast it is possible to play the game.
- It encourages the casual players to play the level again, to beat the ghost. If player enjoys it, they can keep racing leaderboard ghosts at their own skill level. So many people who aren't competitive at this kind of stuff loved racing against the ghost to improve their time.
- It is a goal time to beat like A+ in Super Meat Boy.
- Lets the player figure out new strats or paths to beat the ghost.

I understand you about the graphics, sorry about it, student budget issues.

Also released a patch recently, fixed some of the issues. 

By the way I am a terrible platformer player myself. I also suck at speedrunning but I got used to playing this game while making it for 3.5 years. Here is a full game speedrun by me, a noob speedrunner. You can see how many times I save from failed attempts, if you call them backup strats. 

https://www.twitch.tv/videos/231432401

I'd love to see you give one more chance to Kayra!

this was sold to me by the developer as a "great speedgame" because I do speedrun things.

The visual aesthetic is boring, the controls are awkward, the fact it sends everything I do to the leaderboard before I've even really learned how to play it is annoying. It's like someone made a game based around the misunderstanding that people speedrun video games almost immediately on touching them. Unless your name is authorblues, people don't actually do that. The lack of any sort of visual indicator for the grappling hook makes it exceptionally hard to gauge where anything is going to go since you can only fire the thing at 45 degree angles (yeah I know right I thought it was mouse aim too), you go from 100 - 0 in a really weird unnatural way when you change directions and all of this just makes the game kind of annoying to get to grips with as you grapple (HAH) with its weird unnaturally stiff handling. 

Visual indicators for what is grappleable as well are also totally inconsistent, I never figured out any pattern behind whether or not a particular green or yellow wall would let me grab it. 40056803.review:
Very well designed grapple-platformer with a great engine and emphasis on speedrunning.

You have your left and right movement buttons with 3 actions buttons; grapple (fixed 45 degree angle), jump and dash. The level designs are varied and will force you to learn all the ins and outs of your skill set; you can double jump, reel yourself towards the grapple location with or without dash, run/dash/jump on water when you have enough speed and/or good landing angle - these are just some examples of the diversity you can expect from your abilities.

The movement and physics are top notch and the game often revolves around skillfully maintaining your momentum. Difficulty curve is great but also steep towards the end and while you can take most levels at your own pace with added checkpoints there are some levels that force you to go fast or are short and technical without checkpoints. Decent platforming skill and/or determination is definitely required to finish the game but improving your times is in a sense the meat and potatoes of this game.

Speaking of speedrunning there are level/chapter speedrun/global leaderboards, replay ghosts, input display, replay playback speed options, speedometer, minimap, speedrun mode for full chapters and the game has robust gameplay options, some of which were mentioned in the previous list. Nothing to complain in the audiovisual department either; all around crisp and good stuff. The game also has a competent level editor, so custom levels are a thing you can sink your teeth in as a designer and/or a player.

All in all I'm honestly in love with this game, 40h spent in one week and blistered thumbs to show for it.

40056490.review:
Simple precision platformer with incredibly tight controls and a lot of depth.
Amazing maps with inbuilt leaderboards, and a global leaderboard to compete on right inside of the game (and a speedrun mode!).
Good amount of customization options, including a cosmetic one to show a bit of personality in your replays.

10/10, 100% worth it if you like platformers and/or speedrunning.
Special mention: if you liked Dustforce you're probably going to like this as well.

40052033.review:
Amazing game for those that enjoy challenging platformers and speedrunning! A simple idea of a grappling hook, the ability to reel in and a speed boost which is then explored in different ways for 80+ levels. A difficulty curve that may be a [i]little[/i] too steep for most people, but one which is not insurmountable. Specific level leaderboards which let you view other people's runs in slow motion as well as an overall global leaderboard which is updated every hour and includes different ranks as an incentive to get faster times. A soundtrack which is a little forgetful but enough to be enjoyed for a few hours and an easy to pick up and use level editor as well!

There a few negatives to consider: There is no tutorial, the most help you will receive are prompts scattered throughout the first few levels. The competitive 'ghosts' of other players can at times be confusing when near your own character, however the ghosts can be disabled or made less visible. The leaderboards are not through steam and as such makes finding friends times difficult.

Overall, an extremely fun and addicting platformer which will have you hooked and clambering for the title of 'Descendant of Naezith'

Do you like fast paced platformers?
Do you like Speedrunning?
Good, then you'll LOVE this game!

RoN's gameplay focuses at building momentum using your grappling hook, double jump and dash abilities.
And just with these rather simple mechanics, you can perform all kinds of fancy maneuvers and significanly go beyond the time threshold of "mastering" a stage.

What this game wishes to deliver, it does with excellence.
Since it's heavily focused at speedrunning and leaderboards, then it gives you ALL the tools you could possibly ask for in order to improve your performance:
- Players ghosts to race against.
- Leaderboards replays.
- During replays you get to see the inputs, along with the option to slow it down for deeper inspection.

Another two features besides the main game:
Speedrun mode for each chapter and all chpaters at once.
A simple to use level editor, feel free to go nuts with this.

I won't go into details about the level designs, but I guarantee that there was great effort making sure that they don't feel reptitive, always offering something new and extra that the previous stages didn't have.

On a relative scale of speedrunning games this game gets an easy 10 on my book.
Definitely check it out, even more so if you are a platformers fan.

40003395.review:
(Disclaimer: I was invited by the developer to beta test the game before release. Product was not received for free, I paid for my copy. But I was involved in the development to a very small degree.)

Remnants of Naezith is one of the most challenging, yet rewarding platformers I have played. The mechanics and controls are just solid, with a feel of momentum and speed tuned to perfection that you don't see in other games. With a seemingly non-existent skill ceiling, you really get rewarded for the hours you put in, and the in-game leaderboards and global rankings are perfect to keep you motivated at improving and ultimately show your achievements. The game is just made for speedrunning and is certainly build for longevity, with just how tight and rewarding the gameplay is, on top of the endless possibilities the in-game custom level editor offers, I can see the community for this game to stay alive for years to come.

All of this being said, the game sure is difficult and it might take a little while until you get a full grasp of the mechanics, so if you are the kind of player that gets frustrated easily, or you are just looking for more relaxed/casual gameplay experience, you might have a hard time getting into this. Otherwise, I can wholeheartedly recommend this game. If you are up to the challenge or are experienced with platformers, you will certainly enjoy Remnants of Naezith!

39974752.review:
Remnants of Naezith – это hardcore speedrunner платформер. Который несмотря на простоту картинки, играется просто отлично, а затягивает ещё больше. Сюжет игры прост и незамысловат и заострять на нём внимания не стоить, но надо отметить что крюки у главного героя появляются не просто так.

Думаю надо рассказать, о механики игры и всё что с этим связано. У нашего персонажа вместо кистей рук крюки, которыми он благополучно цепляется за разные поверхности. Так же он умеет прыгать и ускоряться. Сложность заключается в том, что надо нажимать кнопки в определённое время. Но если и этого вам мало, приготовьтесь нажимать сочетание кнопок и тоже в определённый момент. 
Наверное стоит рассказать о главной  фишки игры. Это - как бы странно не звучало «таблица лидеров». Именно она заставляет многих переигрывать и переигрывать уровни и проводить в игре многие часы (по собственному опыту знаю). Есть четыре фактора, которые заставят вас провести в игре не один час, но давайте по порядку:

1. Есть называемое «время мастерства», пока вы не побили это время, вы будете проходить уровень с призраком.
2. В игре можно посмотреть запись всех лучших результатов каждого игрока, каждого уровня.
3. Вы можете посмотреть не просто запись, а в какой момент какие кнопки нажимал тот или иной игрок и так же 
    посоревноваться с их призраками.
4. Есть общий рейтинг, где складывается статистика всех уровней и какое место вы занимаете в них. После этого складывается заключительный «Глобальный рейтинг».

Немного, об остальном. В игре присутствует уйма настроек, что для платформера большая редкость. Такие как, цвет крюков, вкл\откл интерфейса, мини-карта, контрольные точки и т.д. Все перечислять не имеет смысла. Так же в игре присутствует редактор уровней и Speedrun режим, где проходите уровни каждой главы за один раз. Ещё есть секретные предметы для открытия секретных уровней, которые в разы сложнее обычных, но и добраться до предмета будет не легко. В игре просто шикарный саундтрек, хорошая энергичная музыка создаёт такт игре. 

Плюсы:
+ Сложность
+ Реиграбельность
+ Музыка
+ Геймплей
+ Цена

Минусы:
- Сюжет

Что мы имеем в сухом остатке:
Отличный платфомер с высокой сложностью, который займёт вас на долго. Не высокая цена обеспечит доступность всем игрокам. Отличная музыка, которая будет сопровождать вас на пути в лидеры списка. Добавить тут особо нечего, рекомендовать могу всем и хардкорщикам и просто любителям качественных игр.

Итог: 92/100 Рекомендую.

39972931.review:
I had been following this game for awhile, and ended up as a beta tester for it.  As someone who is very amused by grappling hook mechanics, I've been very pleased with it.  The feel of the hook and movement are really solid, there's a huge sense of speed, and the mechanics are deceptively simple, where nothing isn't intuitive, but you'll learn lots of cool tricks to control your character over time.

Beyond the solid core gameplay, there's was a lot of work put in to make sure the replayability is high.  First and foremost is replays.  Every single persons best time on a level has a replay saved that you can watch.  From my experience with dustforce, another game with this feature, it adds a ton to the competitive aspect of the game, building the community, and pushing you to move a little further.  I'm not someone who plays for speed, but I still think every game that has a focus on speed should have leaderboard replays, and it still adds a lot to the game even if I'm not trying to get top times.

Then there's framerate independence (using interpolation), fully mappable controls, tons of various options like hook color customization or the option to turn on stuff like a hook indicator that perfectly predicts where your hook would land if you threw it.  Basically if there was anything the developer knew was wanted and wouldn't detract from the game was added, and it makes this one of the most technically solid games I can think of.

Were this game 20 bucks, I'd reccomend picking it up, at 10, if you're even moderately interested, you absolutely should grab it.

Oyun Supermeatboy tarzında sizi başarmaya ve yeniden oynamaya iten zorluğuyla ön plana çıkıyor. Speedrun meraklıları baz alınarak yapılmış birçok özellik barındırıyor. Oynadığınız bölüm için dünya sıralaması oluşturulmuş olması sizi tekrar tekrar denemeye itiyor. Sizden daha iyi olan oyuncunun gölgesini bölüm içinde görerek hareketlerinden birşeyler kapma fikride çoğu zaman işe yarıyor. Bölüm tasarımları ise bi' harika, geliştirici arkadaş çok akıllıca bölümler tasarlamış. Kanca mekaniği ve fizik motoru o kadar iyi ki biraz ustalaştıktan sonra akıp giden platformlarda akrobatik şekillerde ilerlemek aşırı eğlenceli bir hal alıyor. Oyunun bir hikayeside var, sanat tasarımları ve hikaye böyle bi oyun için gerçekten kaliteli olmuş. Hatta karakterinizin bir kimliğe bürünmesine yardımcı olduğunu bile söyleyebilirim. En çok beğendiğim şey ise müzikler. O kadar iyiler ki ilk defa böyle bi oyunda müziklerin sesini kısmadım. Kısacası oyun desteği sonuna kadar hakediyor. Bence tüm Türk arkadaşların bu oyunu kütüphanesinde tutup böyle yetenekli bir geliştiriciye destek olması gerek. Başarılarının devamını diliyorum umarım oyunun dünya çapında hakettiği değeri görür ve yenisini yaparsın.

39928332.review:
Do you wanna go fast and compete on aggregate leaderboards so that instead of aiming to be top 10. You can aim for the significantly more reasonable goal of top 99%? Then buy this game.
I think I'm in love.

...Ok so it's early enough in the games life that 99% is still top 3 or whatever for most levels but you get my point. Even if it reaches the time when the top 10 are all near 100% perfect execution. You could still have a not-impossible but still mega challenging goal to aim for without it feeling pointless. 
Considering this games main appeal so far is that each level is as much as race against the online ghosts as it is just getting through the level. The fact that it was so well implemented is awesome. You can even set it so that it shows you the ghost of the person 1 rank above you so you can slowly improve and knock them out, without needed to jump straight into crazy launch strats. It's one of the best I've ever seen. 

And the game itself handles like a dream. Sure it's obviously intended for going fast (In fact one might say it doesn't control so well if you're slowing down) but you're never wrestling with the controls for anything. Perfectly smooth framerate, alt-tabs without a hitch, and the animation is delightfully simple and appealing.

Great job devs!

In a game like this where you need to be really precise, it's incredibly frustrating for you inputs to sometimes be ignored.

39892204.review:
I've gotten through the first world so far with mastery times on each level. I'm really enjoying myself, the game does a good job at encouraging the player to improve their times. Aside from the obvious mastery rank, there is a system very similar to Dustforce (another great platformer) where your score is automatically submitted to  a leaderboard with a replay. It's very easy for the player to finish a level, watch a replay of a faster score, and incorporate the techniques they see into their own gameplay. I was able to pick up on techniques before the game introduced them to me in order to improve my times through this replay system. Additionally, as you play, the phantoms of people close to you on the leadboard will run along side you, giving you live feedback on how you stack up with your immediate competition. It's a very good system (though I did have to turn down the visibility on the phantom runners). 

And of course, the way the character moves and controls is very fluid and nice. The grappling hook is going to be your main source of speed, and levels turn into impressive displays of weaving through obstacles between hooks. There are more advanced techniques, of course, to mix things up a bit, but it seems like a system that has a lot of potential. Air control feels responsive and natural. 

The only gripes I can think of are that the soundtrack gets stale really fast and that the visuals aren't particularly inspired or memorable

UPDATE: 
I've completed the second world with all masteries and am three levels into the third. The mastery requirements are getting really challenging at this point; even landing the mastery time gets you into the top 10 for the particular level I am on. This is definitely getting very challenging, assuming you want to truly complete this game. I've also discovered that the checkpoint system becomes kind of useless in the later levels. This game heavily relies on keeping your momentum, and respawning stationary doesn't prepare you for what a normal run of the level would be like. Still enjoying it, though, I am determined to at least master this level

FINAL UPDATE: 
I've completed the third world with all masteries. Levels are beginning to have a much more distinct identity from one another at this point, moving beyond basic momentum building and swinging. I do kind of wish the game prepared you more for some of the challenges in the third world, for example how water drifting works and working around walls without traction, but thankfully replays taught me everything I needed to know to progress. A few new mechanics and environmental hazards have been introduced, and I'm enjoying the variety

39883460.review:
A fast paced platformer that is undeniably influenced from an old IOS game called Hook Champ and its later sequel Super Quickhook. Two of my favorite games on IOS personally.

You can play this casually just to complete levels, go for mastery times on each level for more of a challenge, or even compete for the top spots on the leaderboards for each level. There is also a speedrun mode to complete whole chapters as fast as you can.

The controls are tight and responsive. Which for a platformer of this speed is a necessity. It feels completely natural after only the first few levels. So far through the first world the level design is constantly evolving and having you learn new little nuances that you will use as the levels progressively get harder. I can't wait to see what the later levels have in store.

Being a speed run and leaderboard oriented game the ability to instantly restart the level whenever you want from either the beginning or your last checkpoint is perfect for a game like this.

The music is a nice mix of electronic that is a little forgettable, but does the job of putting something in the background and fits the pace of the game. After a few more hours I can see myself muting the music and just listening to my own stuff.

Overall the game is a definite buy recommendation from me and if you are on the fence a little less than 2 hours(how long it took me to get mastery on the whole first world) is more than enough time to tell if this game is going to be a fit for your tastes.

39879923.review:
What a great speed game!  Once you get the hang of how all the types of movement, and your momentum, all play into each other, you'll be swooping and zipping around levels like you wouldn't believe.  It may seem frustrating at first, but with a little practice the movement in this game can be extremly fast and fluid.

You can play through this game casually, just completing levels and moving on.. but you can get so much more out of the game if you enjoy grinding and perfecting your technique to try to get lower times and better ranks.  There are leaderboards for each level, and even a speedrunning mode where experts can attempt to run through a whole chapter as fast as they can.  

I'm still in the first chapter after almost 3 hours of play, because I can't help but play each stage dozens of times until I'm happy with my time.  The stages are short and sweet, so you won't mind resetting over and over to keep trying.  There's even a convenient keybind and controller button specifically for starting a level over quickly.

The graphics have a very pleasing pixel aesthetic, the music is catchy and suits the gameplay.  It looks and sounds good, unless you hate pixel graphics and electronic music.

It's like "Super Meat Boy" got a grappling hook out of "Speedrunners", but the story is about an ancient dragon posessing your body and lending you some of his strength, so that you might help him seek out and destroy the parts of his body left behind on earth, before foolish humans try to claim their power.

This game supports controller or keyboard.  Either should be fine.  I've been enjoying it on my 360 pad.

I might have more to add later, but for now, I just wanted to leave a review saying what a high-quality game this is.  If it looks like your kind of thing, definitely don't hesitate to get it.

39877429.review:
Well, the best way I can summarize it is- did you think Getting Over It was difficult last year? This game makes it look easy. While not comparable, this is absolutely the hardest platformer i've ever played. So if you're a hardcore bad dude, this games for you. For me i'll probably never finish the tutorial. 

Now that my frustration with the difficulty is over let me talk about the game itself from..the little I could progress. Imagine if Ninja Rope from Worms Armageddon was turned into a full game, awesome right? This is 100% that game. I would honestly recommend this game to people who need Ninja Rope practice. This dev did black magic and replicated it perfectly into a ranked skill-based platformer. This has by far the best speedrunning presentation i've seen. Ghosts, scoreboards, timer at the bottom left, showing how much time you're losing, etc. You can also turn all that stuff off if it fills you with despair when you see that what took you 30 minutes it took someone else 4 seconds.

So, to say overall: This is Worms Armageddon's Ninja Rope turned into a speedrunning platformer. A speedrunner and practicing dream. I would absolutely recommend this game, I couldn't tell you the length because I can't leap past the beginning hurdles, but if you're looking for an itch of having to "git gud" at a videogame, here you go! If not, I would honestly not recommend this game at all. there's no inbetween or easy. So for people like me, we're gated out.

EDIT: I was trash talked a lot for this review, saying that I was too casual. Yet as of this current edit i'm one of 7.1% of all the players who've purchased who have even completed World 2. Less than 10% of people have even finished the 2nd world, that says a lot about how hardcore this game is. It also says that some of the community is a bit too stuck up to see this. 1159 have completed the first level, only 107 have even completed the final stage to progress to World 3. That's a massive drop off because of how extreme the difficulty is.

39876305.review:
If you've ever played Hook Champ or Super Quickhook on iOS, Remnants of Naezith will feel like a re-vamped spiritual sequel to that series. 

Includes some much-appreciated options like an indicator for your hook-path, disabling/enabling checkpoints (disable for when you want to get an ace time or enable when you 'just want to get this level over with'), and some customization for your grappling-hook appearance. Also features optional ghost-racing and online leaderboard to keep it competitive.

Appearance-wise the game is very clean and the only time I would lose track of the character was when I had ghosts at full-opacity (which is another configurable option). The color-contrast between which blocks can and can't be 'hooked' wasn't as high as I would have liked, but after a few minutes it's not too hard to tell which are which.

Includes a pretty good soundtrack, and I haven't heard a track repeat yet.

So far I find it decently challenging and it promises to be a good time-based platformer.

39876225.review:
Full disclaimer: I playtested this game for about 1.5 years and participated in the development in some parts. That being said, I do not earn any revenue from the game and the only reason I recommend it is that it's genuinely a good game.

This game is the perfect mix of Super Meatboy, Dustforce, Speedrunners, and the ninja rope from Worms.

If you like games with tight controls that let you go as fast as you want, this is the game for you.

If you just like fun controls and challenging levels, this is also the game for you.

Seriously just play it. It's good.

39873849.review:
[h1]Remnants of Naezith[/h1]

Ссылка на полный обзор: https://stormplay.ru/reviews/remnants-of-naezith
Куратор в Steam: http://store.steampowered.com/curator/29304702/

Игра достаточно сложная. Суть игры простая, добраться до конца уровня как можно скорей. Здесь своим персонажем можно достигать просто бешеных скоростей.

Управление вроде бы и простое (3 кнопки), не считая кнопок вперед и назад. И в то же время непростое - чтобы пройти уровень быстро, да и вообще чтоб его пройти, надо прожимать все эти кнопки во время. К тому же игра требует от вас необычайной точности.

Вам будет тяжело пройти уровень во время уже начиная с самого первого уровня, а дальше все хуже и хуже. 

Мне понравилось, что прохождение уровней, абсолютно всех игроков записывается. Можно не только посмотреть как проходит уровень любой игрок, так и увидеть какие клавиши он нажимает в момент прохождения.

В каждом уровне есть доминирование - это то насколько ты лучше других игроков. На основании доминирования расчитывается статистика по всем уровням и ты получаешь звание. Их тут 9 - начиная от новичка и заканчивая лучшим игроком.

Вообщем если вы готовы помучиться, то игра для Вас.

39872364.review:
Tek Kişinin Yaptığı Türk Yapımı Bir Oyun İçin Fazlasıyla Kaliteli Bir Oyun. Kesinlikle Kütüphanenizde Yer Alması Gereken Oyunlardan Bir Tanesi.

Oyunda Ana Karakterimiz Kayra 'nın Sihirli Macerasına Tanıklık Ediyoruz. Oyun İlk Başlarda Çok Zor Gelebilir Fakat Alıştığınız Zaman Vazgeçemeyeceğiniz Favori Oyunlarınızdan Bir Tanesi Olacak. Oyunda Ana Bölümlerin Dışında Harita Yapabilir ve Diğer Kişilerin Yaptığı Sayısız Haritaları Oynayabilirsiniz. Benim İçin Sonu Gelmeyen Oyunlar Daha Değerlidir ve Remnants of Naezith 'in Bu Değeri Kazanmamasında Hiç Bir Eksik Yok. Oyunda Amacımız Adından Da Anlaşılacağı Gibi Naezith 'in Dağılmış Sihirli Kalıntılarını Toplamak. Hikayede Olay Tamamiyle Anlatılıyor.

Hikayenin Tamamı;
[spoiler]Efsaneler, bir zamanlar bu topraklarda yaşamış Naezith adında güçlü ve görkemli bir 
ejderhayı anlatır. Denilmektedir ki ölümünden sonra, bedeninin hala muazzam bir güç saklayan 
kalıntıları, doğal olaylar yüzünden yavaşça dünyaya yayılmış. Ancak Naezith hala kendine ait 
gördüğü gücünü paylaşmak istememiş. Bu yüzden ruhu, kalıntılarının gücünü arındırmanın bir yolunu bulmak için asırlarca dolanmış. Binlerce yıl sonra Kayra adına bir maceraperest, bir mağaranın içindeki kalıntıya dair söylentiler duymuş ve halatıyla kancasını kullanarak dalışa geçmiş. Fakat kancası sonunda dayanamamış ve Kayra'nın düşmesine yol açmış, dibi görünmeyen bir çukura... Uyandığında iki büyük ışık saçan tırnağı ellerine sihirli bir şekilde bağlı bulmuş ve dehşete kapılmış. Korkudan deliye dönmüş, kollarını çılgınca sallamış, ancak büyü bozulmamış. Bunun yerine tırnak elinden fırlamış ve karşıdaki duvara sıkıca saplanmış. Tırnak ve eli arasında gördüğü sihirli ışın, eski halatına epey benzer şekilde çalışmaktaymış. Aniden, Naezith, Kayra'nın karşısına çıkmış ve ona amaçlarını gerçekleştirmek için fiziksel bir vücuda ihtiyaç duyduğunu söylemiş. Sınırsız hazine sözü karşılığında Kayra, ejderhanın vücuduna kısmen egemen olmasını kabul etmiş ve onun güçlerini kullanarak Naezith'in kalıntılarını arındırmaya başlamış. [/spoiler]
